title: Alpha stage of Project#10
content:
I guess I should finally announce this project. I haven't decided on a proper name yet, as I haven't truly fleshed out the story details yet, so I'm just calling it "Alpha stage of Project10". I've been working on it since July 21st, but I won't say what I've done and what I haven't done. Nor will I give you a story or any story specifics. I will say that I'm treating the story with utmost dignity. I will, however, tell you about raw details:


Zeroethly, and most importantly, this is not Keen & Norp. Though heavily influenced by that game idea, this is not the same game. (IE: You will not play as Norp, and I am using the name "Spot" as the more canon form.) Well, I can't rule out that you won't be playing as Spot, but it will be highly unlikely.

Firstly, I intend to do a Newtonian mechanics physics engine. What does this entail? Gravity and friction forces, fluidity and bauyancy, and a few other concepts. This will be nothing seriously game-breaking. I'm doing this for my good more than your own.

Secondly, and possibly most importantly, lightly 3D shaded graphics. What does this mean? It means that it will have much more depth to this semi-isometric (Keen 4 style) view. It will have backdrops, tiles, etc. Also, I should note, all of these graphics will be completely original. THIS DOES NOT MEAN 3D MODELING!

Thirdly, there will be Advanced AI. I really hate these stupids AI's that just walk across the screen doing the same actions, ocasionally jumping after a set timer. My AI will be programmed to respond to Keen. Expect this. They might also respond to eachother; this part is still in the air. Basically: Enemy interaction.

Fourthly, as you all might have guessed, all original Keen 4-6, and Dreams sounds will be included in MP3 form. Also, it will use classic Keen 4-6 music, and possibly Cosmo music if I see fit.

Fifthly, the engine will have significant, and yet not so significant, changes in the basic engine we have grown so accustomed to in Keen 4. This is done because I'm sick of playing the same Keen game with the same faces and same gameplay as the Keen 4 engine. So what will it be like? Well, it will have multi-weapons, health, basic score points, no more Life Droplets, and the basic Jump/Pogo/Swim features. Hanging on edges is still up in the air. Basically I will just say that it will be largely influenced the '93 and beyond style of games beign created by Apogee.


The main question is going to be: "So is this still going to be Keen?"

The answer is quite simply: "Yes"

Wait and see, I have good ideas for this game.


This is the scoop that I'm giving you guys right now. Screens, the text story, website, and Demos will all come much later. I'm treating this like Apogee is Duke Nukem Forever: 'coming: when it's done'. I could release my story tomarrow or December of 2007.~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
I've changed a lot since my last time on this forum...

Hey, rather than be secretive about it and say "UGH IT'S NOT WORKING I GIVE UP" why not post what you've got so far, and open-source the bugger? We've got a few people here with coding knowledge; with our combined efforts, I bet we could get something decent made.

title: Re: Programming 101
content:
lol, yeah, it's object-oriented programming.

You have several file libraries:


Sprites
Sounds
Backgrounds
Paths
Scripts
Fonts
Timelines
Objects
Rooms


Basically, the programming is then subdivided into Events for Objects:

Creation, Pressing keys, releasing keys, each Step events (When they are re-drawn), Collision, Alarm, Destroy, and other "events".

Then you put your code into those Events.~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

title: Re: Programming 101
content:
Lemur --yeah, that's what I'm going to do.

[quote]Quote:[hr]
[Pogo, a spring is too *simple* for a basic motion equation? Whateverhappened to F = kd^2?]
[hr][/quote]

Umm.. No, that's wrong:

F = k*x
E = 1/2*k*x^2


k = spring constant, gauged in Newtons/Meter. How could you sqaure the distance (Meters^2) and then multiply it by Newtons/Meter and not get Joules? The second equation is for the potential energy of a Spring.


Also, Bernouli didn't make the aerodynamics equations that do viscosity of fluids. Navier and Stokes did.~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

title: Re: Programming 101
content:
You just can't press more than 4 keys at once on a keyboard, or it will start to beep.

Actually it depends on the keyboard - I've used really cheap ones that won't let you press more than two keys at once, which makes gaming impossible. I've even used one keyboard where a common key sequence (something like strafing to the left while firing) made the keyboard send the 'escape' keycode, so every time I tried that move the main menu would pop up...really annoying.

title: Re: Programming 101
content:
Wow, that must be an old one.
But DaVince, I only press up, left, and alt and get a beep. that's thre keys, and it doesnt beep on any combination of three.
F, T, and D beep, so do F, T, and A, but F, T, and C dont.- .... . <> ..- -. .. ...- . .-. ... . <> .. ... <> - --- .- ... -

title: Re: Programming 101
content:
From what I know about keyboards, keys are grouped somehow (perhaps the groups are wired to one central cable going to the main output cable of the keyboard), and you can't press more than three or four keys in one group. For example, Q, A and Z are all in the same group so the keyboard gives a beep. I guess it has something to do with the cables inside the keyboard, not overpowering what they can handle.

If a certain combination won't work, try using different action keys for your game. Or make it gamepad compatible. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-cheeky.gif[/img] ____________
Don't think of me as an ordinary man.

Even though I am an ordinary man.
